intro: Gnidia polygalifolia, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has a woody stem that becomes more prominent with age. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forested areas.
